Reviews.Title: “Ask for a Room at the Back!”
Reviews.Author: Freddowasher
Reviews.Content: This is quite a well located hotel. Easy walking distance from the Paseo de Gracia and close to Metro & the Gracia railway station. The rooms are OK, beds are average, large shower, hair dryer, air conditioning and a safe in the wardrobe and are fine for a short stay. The floors are laminated so you can hear people walking about at night but thankfully people were very quiet. The breakfasts are fine. You can have an express one which is coffee & some small croissants for 3 Euros or full breakfast for 8 Euros. The staff were lovely, very helpful with maps and advice about travelling and speak very good English. The main problem we had was the noise level. There was a lot of work going on with concrete mixers outside our window as they are re-modelling the Gracia railway station just next to the hotel and this continued late into the night. When that stopped there was still a lot of noise from traffic as the traffic lights are just outside the hotel and bike riders just seemed to be revving up constantly waiting for the lights to change. The road-works can't be helped but the double glazing isn't efficient enough for the noise level. We could have asked to be moved but we had hoped it would just be bad for that night. It wasn't. It's a nice enough hotel for a couple of nights, in a good location and good value for the price we paid. Just make sure you ask for a room away from the Via Augusta if you are not a heavy sleeper. The road-works are temporary but the late night traffic could be a more long term problem.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: Nitin M
Reviews.Content: This is a basic bed and breakfast type of hotel. It is located on Via Augusta and has very good accessibility to the metro station. The Good: - Very friendly and helpful staff. They speak good english. - Great Location - Decently clean - Basic but nice breakfast. The Bad: - Very cramped room for the price. - Bathrooms are not well designed. When I took bath the water was all over the place. - No english channels in the TV - View from the window is pathetic. My window opened towards the back of the building and there was bad odour when i opened the window. Conclusion: If you want to be near the Via Agusta, or Gracia or Provincia Metro Station, this is a good hotel to sleep. Gives good connectivity to many tourist attractions. But if you plan to spend more time indoors then this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeeaEla
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends just returned from this hotel yesterday and I can definitely say that we had a very nice surprise. The hotel is located very close to Gracia Subway and is only at 2 stations of Plaza Catalunya. The reception team were very nice, the rooms that we received were big and the breakfast was good (for a 2 stars hotel). If we will visit again Barcelona, for sure we'll choose Augusta Hotel !

Reviews.Title: “very good choise hotel in very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Zachi S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel is renovated. everything is clean and looks new. the rooms which turn to the road are very nice. Me and my wife had really good time in Barcellona and we enjoyed returning to the hotel every evening after long day of travelling. Also the staff was very pleasant. The hotel is rated as 2 stars but it felt like 3 stars quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: sues40
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in February. Don't know what some of these reviewers want! Large, clean room and bathroom with shower and toiletries and good hair dryer. Pleasant seating area with comfortable leather furniture outside room. Excellent choice of breakfast. Very good service. Triple glazing cut road and roadworks noise so it was not intrusive. Could hear trains but only if you listened for them. Not a problem. Not sure if room on road would be acceptable in summer with window open as it would be very noisy till about 5am. Air con controlled in room worked efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TonyPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: Stayed there early december for 3 nights. Place was great, the room was small, but thes ervice was excellent, the room was very clean, the staff was great and breakfast was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Superb for 2 star”
Reviews.Author: CuleBlue
Reviews.Content: Located in the nice Fontana area if the city about 15 minutes from Catalunya this spotlessly clean, modern hotel is my first choice. Comfy with a TV with foreign channels, a good shower and free wifi, I'm not sure what else you need.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a city break”
Reviews.Author: screename
Reviews.Content: The rooms are well appointed, modern and very clean. The staff are always pleasant and helpful. Breakfast is fine, not the widest choice but just enough. This is a great hotel for a short city break, either on business or just sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Only hotel I could find in Barcelona this particular week”
Reviews.Author: IntlTrainer
Reviews.Content: This isn't the usual hotel I stay in when I travel to Barcelona. There was a big congress there and all the hotels were full. My travel agent found this hotel on one of the online booking sites. It is not too far from the center - maybe a 6 euro cab ride to the Plaza Catalunya. I had a room on the backside of the hotel so it was quiet. Every room is a different size and layout - some look very small. They gave me a smoking room - but I didn't complain because I couldn't smell the smoke. I had a single room and the bed was a twin bed and kind of hard with a flat pillow. Room was clean but nothing special. The breakfast was extra 8 euro and a buffet. It was fairly good - I don't have any complaints about it. There was stuff that I like to eat when I go to Spain. The front desk staff were nice. It was a little pricey considering the location and quality of the room. Maybe the price was high because of the congress.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful on Sunday Mornings”
Reviews.Author: Wolfgang V
Reviews.Content: We had a room that was near a large church bell tower. It is loud on Sunday mornings and will shake the room. The rooms were not too fancy but very clean. So if you go out to the nightclubs and want to sleep in on Sunday forget about it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: SammyUgg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Gracia district, which is a safe residential area. The metro station is a few meters away, although I walked to the center of the city (it takes about 30 minutes to reach the Placa de Catalunya by foot). The room was clean and tidy. The staff were polite and helpful. Checking in and out was very easy. Will visit again once I'm in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Some very rude staff. Air conditioning not right.”
Reviews.Author: joewrigg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for many years and have always enjoyed its basic but good facilities. There was a problem with the air conditioning unit and we requested a change of room when technical staff failed to repair it. This was met with rudeness and sarcasm by a male member of staff who enjoyed showing off his italian to other customers. He seemed to confuse sarcasm with a good sense of humour. Two very different things and a serious lack of professionalism from his part. The other members of staff were far more helpful. It is a shame that one member of staff can change ones overall view of a service. I will not stay at this hotel or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: ValenciaScarlett
Reviews.Content: Relatively good location as a start off point for exploring the city. Basically good hotel for sleeping and showering but very little else. Buffet breakfast included in the price but pretty run of the mill fare. Room we stayed in was small and hot despite the a/c. Luckily it was a room at the back so we weren't subjected to any noise from the major road works at the front. Make sure you get a room at the back otherwise you won't be able to get much sleep! The main problem I would like to mention isn't about the hotel itself but two rather disagreeable male receptionists on the front desk. One of them (the fluent Italian speaker) was especially rude, offensive and showed a distinct lack of professionalism. The other was simply an amateur. The management of the hotel should consider not allowing these two employees to deal with guests as because of them, we won't be returning or recommending the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best 2 Stars Hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Cristina_Hugo
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Via Augusta for a week before Christmas and can only say good things about this beautiful Hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms have a modern and functional look. Another great surprise was the breakfast with a lot of hot and cold food to choose from and with different options everyday. At 400 meters you can find the Fontana subway station. Parc Güell is at 15/20 minutes walk from the Hotel. Passing Avinguda Diagonal you can find Passeig de Grácia with all it's beautiful stores. Also don't miss Gaudí’s Casa Batlló and La Pedrera. Be sure to stay at this Hotel if you visit Barcelona...

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: missstitchnsew Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and were very happy with it. The staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and tidy. The hotel is situted very close to a metro station and is about 20-30 minutes walk from the old town (all down hill). Breakfast was simple, but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Ryanhamer1984
Reviews.Content: Virtually next door to Gracia tube station so easily access to anywhere. There arn't many resturants / bars close to the hotel, but that isn't really a problem. as the tube is so close Very clean, great value for money. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: orly83
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in great location, few steps from FGC station and 5 min walk from metro station. very nice neighborhood as well. the room is clean and nice, has all the basics in it. for it's price and rating I think it is a great hotel, we really enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: diana_rab
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights.The hotel is situated near the center of Barcelona nearby the tube station Gracia, which was very convenient. The room was clean and very quiet. The staff were very helpful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “good location in the center of Barcelona, clean rooms but heating systems did not work, rooms were too cold!!”
Reviews.Author: Istanbulibra34
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel on December 2010. Location is good in the city center. Room was clean and the decoration was OK. Staff friendly and helpful. But the problem was; the room was terribly cold. Heating systems did not work properly. I stayed there two nights, the first night was managable therefore did not complain, but the second night was terribly cold that I regretted staying at that Hotel. I could be sick because of that. I informed staff about this problem, at 08:00a.m, because I came to the Hotel at 05:00 a.m. After some hard discussions and negotiations, the staff accepted to give 10%discount because of the problem. They also confirmed that there was a problem with the heating system. They let me to another room to rest for 2-3hrs although I already did the check-out. However the other room was also very cold too unfortunately. The staff helped to work on solutions, but there was a problem with the Hotel infrastructure. There are only air conditions in each room for heating, and that was not enough to heat the rooms. and the room was humid. In addition to this problem, during the first night of my accomodation there, during 05:00a.m there were extreme noises from the next room. I do not recommend this hotel as a result because of those problems that I encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: travellerIndian
Reviews.Content: Well located, next to Gracia metro stop on FGC metro line, about 300 metres from Fontana metro station on metro Line 3. Reasonably good breakfast and fast internet. Staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. Helped us to find a good Indian restaurant to have food. Bathroom needed shower curtain as water spilled all over due to no bath tub. Bed mattresses are spring based, which could be more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but decent”
Reviews.Author: madridvoyageur
Reviews.Content: Recently renovated, well equiped, clean and not far from Barcelona dowtown. My room was on a small internal patio (surprisingly it had a balcony) and was very quiet. Staff was nice and helpful. Free Internet in the rooms. On the other hand, there is nothing exciting about the hotel decoration, the room was small and the bathroom got totally flooded when I had a shower (I didn't realize until I got out of the cubicle). Quite decent if you are not going to spend time in your room and you are not on a romantic trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, quality at an affordable price.”
Reviews.Author: kivjawz
Reviews.Content: At first my friend and I were concerned about reviews here about bedbugs, but we decided to give it a try anyhow because the price was right and the photos of the rooms look pretty good. And I can say now we made the right decision. Our 3-night stay there was good value. It was quality for a very affordable price. The rooms were clean and sufficient, the breakfast was up to standard and the service of the staff were all very professional. The reception was ever ready to dish out help and advice. We also liked the location of the hotel. It is within a short walking distance of the Fontana metro, and Fontana is near to many of the sights and shopping in Barcelona. We appreciate that the location gives us a little bit of quiet away from the main city buzz, and yet is still convenient. Best of all, the hotel very generously offered my friend and I the option of two single rooms with breakfast thrown in, even though we originally booked a twin room. If you go through all the reviews here, you can see that the hotel people often took the trouble to address any negative points brought up here. It just shows they care enough about their business and about quality.

Reviews.Title: “centrally located, clean and inexpensive functional hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ernestjames
Reviews.Content: paid EUR 65 for a last minute web booking the hotel is clean, rooms are simple, modern and quiet very convenient for walking around Barcelona - had a great dinner at Bodeguita de la Provenca just off Rambla Catalunya which was only 7 minutes walk away from the hotel no frills

Reviews.Title: “A nice two star hotel:-)”
Reviews.Author: ForrestNL
Reviews.Content: I have been this hotel over two days and general impression is very positive. Considering the fact that it is a two star hotel, I would like to recommend it to anyone who are into a budget hotel in the centrum. The room is neat with basic facilities(No refrigerator, though). The location is conveniet(10 mins walk to the metro Fontana). The great isolation(just metro pass onder the building with a bit noise, however I would not say it disturbing). The staff do their job okay. At least check-in is quick and friendly. There is Wifi internet and connection is sufficient for email or internet. The breakfast is basic but there are warm and cold dishes, for a two star hotel it is pretty good, I should say. The surrounding area is not that tourist but there are nice streets in Cracia area nearby the hotel. Oh, the mattress is a bit hard for me however it is totally a personal opinion. To sum up, an excellent two star hotel to stay:-)

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Gaudi.”
Reviews.Author: StripeyLu Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We got a pleasant surprise, great breakfast, clean and pleasant staff. If you're visiting to see Gaudi's architecture then this is a perfect spot. It's away from the tourist bits so loads of small places to eat and cake shops with normal prices. Would definitely come to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than the 2 stars”
Reviews.Author: FinnFrode
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Via Augusta for 3 nights this week. Our room on 7th floor was spacious, had a great view and despite facing the street, not very noisy. Furniture in good quality, although I fear that having wheels under the two beds could cause accidents with honeymooners... The room had a quality TV with 15 channels (missing BBC World,), free Wi-Fi internet and a safe in the big locker. The bathroom was as big as some double-rooms in London <g> Functional with lots of very hot water. Unfortunately missing a bathroom curtain, which caused some water spillage on the floor. The breakfast buffet was well worth the money payed when we ordered the room. A good variety of cereals, cold dishes, fruit, bread and cakes. As expected the hot dishes spanned less wide, but included the local potato omelette, sausages, bacon and boiled eggs. The staff was most friendly and helpful and all in all the hotel is much better than the 2 stars it currently holds. It seems to have undergone a major restoration, so maybe thats why? Our room was spotlessly clean as was the hotel everywhere we went. Some corridors below still seem to be awaiting a finishing touch on the restoration, but clean nonetheless. The location was OK for us, as we prefer to stay outside the tourist areas. Some traffic, but except for that a quiet and apparently safe neighbourhood. Metro FGC-Gràcia just outside the door and also Metro Fontana in a nearby street. Busses in many directions including Camp Nou stadium (switch to tram at Francesc Macià). Finally one detail of great importance to some of us: This hotel offer smoking rooms. Non-smokers need not worry, as this is clearly marked on the doors.

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality/price”
Reviews.Author: CichoSzaa
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel for business trips. My room was rather small but comfortable and extremely clean. Staff was very nice and helpful. Location is good - not the very city center but right next to the metro station. If you need to do shopping it is close to good shopping area. Good quality for low price. And free and fast wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “very good 2 star hotel, extermely clean,good variety breakfast,good central location”
Reviews.Author: TracieS2
Reviews.Content: good area to stay in, near to nitelife in gracia,an close enough to reach major attractions.good rooms but no view!close to the underground to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Wery positivly surprised”
Reviews.Author: vidibreovo
Reviews.Content: I work in one tourist agency in Belgrade, Serbia, and we have this hotel in our offer. This summer I was wisiting my friend in Barcelona,and I went in this hotel to see it. I was wery satesfied with everithin what I see ther (rooms, toilets, lobby, restourant, aerea...). This hotel have 2 stars in our catalogue,but my opinion is that he deserve minimum 3 stars. Hotel is situeted in the best part of Barcelona - Gracia,wery quiet and peacefull. Menager Miguel Alba is very genty person and I will recomend this hotel to our clients.

Reviews.Title: “Stay far away, they have bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: SamsaraCambridge
Reviews.Content: The hotel was decent, good location, and reasonable, BUT I implore you to stay as far away from it as possible. I was in Barcelona for a conference in March, and my Spanish colleagues booked this place for us (other colleagues traveling from all over the world). I was stuck in an airless windowless room the first night, and then insisted that they move me to a better room. I remember getting bitten on my arms and legs, but thought it was mosquito bites. Only when I returned home to the States, and then a few weeks later, the truth emerged. The hotel is infested with bed bugs! They came back with me, and my life has been turned upside down. I've had to discard my mattress, and have gone through hell, not to mention the expense of replacing a bed. I'm still not sleeping in my own bedroom for fear of the bed bugs. So, no matter what you do, DO NOT stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Poor manager”
Reviews.Author: vallenor
Reviews.Content: Overall the quality of the hotel was was expected for the price but the attitude of the manager was abysmal. Upon checkout my partner and I were presented with a surprising bill of 55 Euroes for three days of breakfast. We were told, upon check in by a member of the reception staff, that the breakfast was included in the price we prepaid. This was a nice surprise to us as we only booked the room; so we, naturally, had breakfast each morning. When we were presented with the bill we, obviously, agreed as we hadn't actually paid for the service. However, the manager neither: admitted any responsibility for the confusion, make any suggestion that he would talk to the mentioned member of staff nor did he seem the slightest bit apologetic for the misunderstanding. He was extremely dismissive with our complaints and treated us like thieves. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone due to the blatant lack of respect and terrible customer service of the managerial staff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and new but far from city center”
Reviews.Author: travelingbeta
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night and paid $64 USD through hotels.com. The price did not include breakfast. Location is far from the city center, but the Fontana metro station is a 10 minute walk away. It'll take you two transfers from the airport and a lot of walking. There's really nothing to do in the area, but it has a few shops nearby where you can pick up bottled water and bread for a breakfast to go. The hotel room was VERY clean with hardwood floors and even a flatscreen tv. The bathroom was also clean, but I had no shower door so water leaked out of the shower and slightly flooded the bathroom. However, that was managable.

Reviews.Title: “Less than expected...”
Reviews.Author: _________ed_______87
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after searching for hours and for most of `good` options on the price range I wanted to pay, always had a bad review somewhere... but this one had good or `okay` ones only. As most of reviews for hotels in Barcelona say, personal there is not well trained and they sound quite rude. I guess it is a cultural difference, as I am brazilian and living in London, I am really not used to people being cold when they are actually working for me. Here and in brazil people uses to smile a lot more and use words like please, thank you, sorry... in London they do it a lot. Anyway, the room was really small, smaller than expected, the window was locked and could not be opened. As Barcelona in summer time is a really hot place, we did not want to open that window and just let the air con on all time we were inside. The bathroom had a big window and it was not locked, which was great... for the first 4 days. Out of blue they locked the bathroom`s window one day (while cleaning i guess) and we had no key for it. I asked on the reception and they came up with this absolute nonsene about being against the local law to open those windows, because they were too big. It was an awful experience to use a bathroom with no windows... they should train that people to came up with better excuses, put smaller and open window or an air con inside bathroom as well. I don`t think this hotel is a good option as it is a bit far from everything and it is not a good value for money. I definitily not going back there.

Reviews.Title: “About my Experience with Via Augusta”
Reviews.Author: Mihaiconstanta
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine, no noise if you close the window, a little to poor breakfast but OK. Personnel not very friendly and did not involved in solving problems: for example, after 3 nights of staying at Via Augusta, my pyjamas dissapeared!!! I told to all receptionists about this but they did nothing about this for 3 more days! This left me a bad impression: they told me that I can buy a new pyjamas and the hotel will pay but it was almost midnight in the last night spent there: too late. Besides, I was only looking for hearing something like: "WE ARE VERY SORRY FOR THIS, AND APPOLOGIZE", not to buy me a new pyjamas!!! Sometimes, a nice word values equal to thousand pyjamas! That's why I said personnel not very friendly (or maybe not very well trained). And now I remember a holiday in Bulgaria (Hotel Krystal - Golden Sands): my boyfriend forgot a jacket on the tennis field and after 2 weeks when we go back there (we live in Constanta - Romania, at 150 km away and go there frequently) we found the jacket at the Reception. More than a jacket, we get a smile!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Via Augusta for a weekend at the end of March '08. At first we asked for a room opposite of the street, as we had read at this site below, that there could be noise from the street. But what a mistake! We got a room without a window. So we asked for a new room, which was much better. There is a metro stop nearby, which makes it very easy to reach the center. The breakfast included eggs, sausages, pastry, fruit, ect. everything! It was so great :) The staff was friendly and they even arranged for us to eat breakfast half an hour before it normally opened on our day of departure and a early flight. Near by we found a great local tapas bar, but don't remember the name of it. We can definetly recommend the Via Augusta.
